The editor window pane is used to edit the source code of the
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#class classes in your Eiffel project. Toload a
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#class class into the editoryoumustdouble-click on the particular
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#class class you wish to edit in either the
../30_Class_View/index.html ClassView or
../20_Solution_Explorer/index.htm SolutionExplorer . To edit more than one
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#class class simultaneously just double-click another
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#class class and this will appear in a separate tab in the editor pane. The screenshot below illustrates a project with 3
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#class classes opened for editing in the editor window pane.

Once inside the editor you can edit the source code as you would any Eiffel
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#class class ; add or remove class
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#attribute attributes ,
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#feature features ,
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#inheritance inheritance clauses,
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#precondition preconditions and
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#postcondition postconditions or any other feature provided by the Eiffel Language.
The editor provides a number of useful features for the developer:

list.item: Syntax coloring: Eiffel syntax keywords (such as create, is, do, end) are automatically colored in the text to make it easier to read and find different parts of the text more quickly. Also, syntax elements such brackets and curly braces are colored, making it much easier to spot syntax errors and correct them quickly.

Member completion: provides a context-sensitive list of
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#feature features available to the
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#class class being edited. For example, if you are have a STRING variable 'a_string' and wish to clear the contents of the STRING at a certain point in your code, when you type 'a_string' in the editor and then press the '.' to denote a
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#feature feature call on 'a_string' the list will appear displaying all available
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#feature features from 'a_string' to the current class. This is extremely useful as it gives a quick overview of the available
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#feature features and automatically completes the
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#feature feature name in the text once selected. This feature only works if the
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#feature feature of the
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#class class being edited is complied into the system, so to take full advantage it is best to compile your system as soon as you add new
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#feature features .

Parameter information: when using a
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#feature feature from a
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#class class which takes
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#argument argument parameters the parameter information is displayed automatically when the opening bracket is entered into the text. This is similar to member completion and gives quick and immediate details about the argument parameters a
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/10_Terminology.htm#feature feature requires and the return type of the, if any.

item.paragraph:
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/70_Debugging_Projects/breakpoints.htm Break Points : Using the left margin of the editor
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/70_Debugging_Projects/breakpoints.htm Break Points may be set by simply clicking the margin at the line of code you wish a
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/70_Debugging_Projects/breakpoints.htm Break Points to be inserted.
